qas.question: What is the opposite of a Show Up?
Who must sign a White Ticket?
What punishment term is "info" short for?

plausible_answers.text: torn at the top of the page/sheet

qas.question: What action is colloquially known as a Show Up?
What are boys who accumulate Show Up's liable to receive?

plausible_answers.text: doing domestic chores or writing lines

qas.question: What are some of the consequences of earning a Show Up?
Who must sign a Show Up?

context: The opposite of a Show Up is <a0_0>a "Rip"<a0_0/>. This is for sub-standard work, which is sometimes <b5_0>torn at the top of the page/sheet<b5_0/> and must be submitted to <a1_0>the boy's housemaster<a1_0/> for signature. Boys who accumulate rips are liable to be given a "<b6_0>White Ticket<b6_0/>", which must be signed by <a2_0>all his teachers<a2_0/> and may be accompanied by other punishments, usually involving <b7_0>doing domestic chores or writing lines<b7_0/>. In recent times,[when?] a milder form of the rip, '<a4_0>sign for information<a4_0/>', colloquially known as an "info", has been introduced, which must also be signed by <a3_0>the <b8_0>boy's housemaster and tutor<b8_0/><a3_0/>.
